com.malikk.shield.flags

Class Flag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.malikk.shield.flags.Flag
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Flag
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A flag object allows for sets of players to be assigned boolean values in certain regions.
    Author:
    Malikk
    See Also:
    #getName()}, #getRegion()}, #getPlayers()}, #getValue()}, #setPlayers(players)}, #setValue(boolean)}, #addPlayer(player)}, #addPlayers(players)}, #removePlayer(player)}, #removePlayers(players)}, #remove()}, Serialized Form

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue()
        Gets the value that the flag will return for players in its HashSet. For players not in the HashSet, the opposite of this value will be returned.
        Returns:
        value - Boolean assigned to the flag

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> players)
        Sets the HashSet of player names for this flag to the one passed in. (Will completely overwrite the previous Set)
